FacilityName: Helena Chemical Company - Falls City, NE Facility

_prev_prog_2.MH_OtherType: Vehicle or Projectile Strike, Vandalism, Theft, or Terrorism
_prev_prog_2.CH_OtherChanges: Removed stationary pressure vessels.  Nurse Tank storage only.
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Storage tanks, process piping, valves, pumps, and transfer hoses
_prev_prog_2.Description:
The Branch Manager implements the Risk Management Plan (RMP) and Risk Management Program (RMPr) for the Storage of anhydrous ammonia Nurse Tanks at this facility and is assisted by other Helena staff as directed. The RMPr describes the Accident Prevention Program that includes Safety Information, Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Training, Maintenance, Compliance Audits, Incident Investigation, and Emergency Response.  Equipment included under this covered process includes (5) 1,465-gallon nurse tanks, (15) 1,450-gallon nurse tanks, (1) 1,415-gallon nurse tank, (26) 1,000-gallon nurse tanks, and (10) 1,000-gallon double nurse tanks.  



Anhydrous ammonia is not transferred at this Facility.  At certain times of the year, the Facility may store Nurse Tanks in preparation for maintenance or the Facility might temporarily store a nurse tank in anticipation of transport to a customer location for application.  Nurse Tank transportation and storage is conducted in accordance with the RMP Operating Procedures.

_emerg_resp.FR_OtherRegulation: This is a non-responding facility and it coordinates its response activities with the LEPC and local Fire Department. Notification information and procedures are provided in its Contingency Plan.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Helena Chemical Company (Helena) Falls City, NE Facility has submitted this updated electronic RMP in compliance with the provisions of the Clean Air Act 112 (r) as codified by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency at 40 CFR Part 68. Standards codified by the Occupational Safety and Health Administration at 29 CFR 1910.119 are not applicable to the operations at this facility because the facility is operated as a retail operation and is exempt from the OSHA standards.  However, the OSHA standards at 29 CFR 1910.111, Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia, are applicable and are included in the Risk Management Program (RMPr) document that is implemented by this Facility.



This electronic submittal provides conservative estimates of the offsite consequences of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia from the Falls City, NE Facility located at 5th and Wilson Street, Falls City, NE 68355.  The electronic RMP summarizes the policies and procedures implemented by the Falls City, NE Facility to minimize the likelihood of an accident.  The electronic RMP also summarizes the actions that the Falls City, NE Facility has taken to ensure that a response to a release will be implemented in a proper and timely manner.



PURPOSE FOR UPDATING RMP



Helena is submitting this as a 5-year update because it has significantly altered the prior Storage & Handling Process by removing all of the stationary pressure vessels from service at this Facility. Removal of the stationary pressure vessels required the revision to the off-site consequence analysis.  The updates are reflected in both the EPA RMP Submit report and the Facility Risk Management Plan Program Document (RMPr).



FACILITY



The Falls City, NE Facility is a retail agricultural chemical facility and operates one (1) covered process that includes Storage of anhydrous ammonia Nurse Tanks.  Anhydrous ammonia is not transferred at this Facility.  At certain times of the year, the Facility may store Nurse Tanks i

n preparation for maintenance or the Facility might temporarily store a nurse tank in anticipation of transport to a customer location for application.  Nurse Tank transportation and storage is conducted in accordance with the RMP Operating Procedures.  Equipment included under this covered process includes (5) 1,465-gallon nurse tanks, (15) 1,450-gallon nurse tanks, (1) 1,415-gallon nurse tank, (26) 1,000-gallon nurse tanks, and (10) 1,000-gallon double nurse tanks.  



OFF-SITE CONSEQUENCE ANALYSIS



Worst case and alternative case consequence analyses were completed for the single covered process that is operated at this Facility.  The covered process includes storing anhydrous ammonia Nurse Tanks.  The worst case scenario release for the Retail Facility assumes that all the contents in the largest single nurse tank are released.  For this Facility, the largest nurse tank is 1,465-gallons.  The release was modeled as if the ammonia tank was punctured on the side at the ground level. The resulting release of ammonia was modeled as a ground level horizontal jet.



The alternative release for the Nurse Tank Storage assumes a 60-minute release from a pressure relief valve on the Nurse Tank that fails to re-seat.  



ACCIDENT PREVENTION PROGRAM



The Branch Manager implements the risk management planning process at this Facility.  The Branch Manager is assisted by other Helena staff, as directed.  The Branch Manager is responsible for ensuring that Helena Staff are properly trained in the implementation of the Prevention Program which includes Safety Information, Hazard Analysis, Operating Procedures, Training, Maintenance, Compliance Audits, Incident Investigations, and Emergency Contingency Plans.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



Helena's Falls City, NE Facility is a non-responding facility. Helena has coordinated emergency response activities with its local emergency response agency and local fire department.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There have been no

on-site deaths, injuries, or significant property damage; or off-site deaths, injuries, property damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place, in the past five (5) years because of the ammonia operations at the Falls City, NE Facility.



CONCLUSION



The Risk Management Plan implemented by Helena Chemical Company at the Falls City, NE Facility complies with the requirements of the Clean Air Act, Section 112(r). The RMP will be updated as the Falls City, NE Facility adds, deletes, or changes processes. The Emergency Response Program has been coordinated with the Richardson County LEPC and the Falls City Rural Fire Department.  



NOTE: Sections 4, 5, 6, and 7 of the standard RMP produced by EPA's RMP Submit Program are not applicable to the Falls City, NE Facility.
